cont.entity_a: Very compact. Fits easily in any pocket and works well with an armband accessory.
Sound, controls, and battery life are great.
cont.entity_b: Sound quality for some MP3 files is not great.

cont.entity_a: No memory available to store favorite radio stations. Radio feature is good but lacks memory for stations.
Quick charge time: 3 minutes for 3 hours playback, 30 minutes for 18 hours.
cont.entity_b: Battery retention mechanism is delicate. Replaceable battery issues, including swelling.

cont.entity_a: Software is more solid than previous versions but locks device to one PC. Proprietary software is tricky at first. Music transfer requires proprietary software, not direct MP3 copy. Software allows for fast song transfer but alters file format. Software freezing issues on some computers. Software required for music transfer limits use to one computer. Software is quirky and not user-friendly. Loading audiobooks can be difficult due to file format changes. Software is necessary for file transfer, which can be limiting.
cont.entity_b: Easy to transfer music without special software. Simple to use with Windows Media Player.

cont.entity_a: Small, light, and good sound quality.
Screen is dim and hard to read in daylight. Some units have display issues in bright light.
cont.entity_b: Buttons and display are difficult to use. Display screen issues after a short period.

cont.entity_a: Holds a lot of music and serves as a flash memory.
cont.entity_b: 256 MB capacity for storing songs. Low storage capacity compared to newer models.
Battery latch can break easily. Some units fail shortly after purchase. Headphone jack issues after a few months.

cont.entity_a: Ergonomic and easy to handle for running or in-car use.
Built-in USB interface eliminates the need for an extra cable. Compatible with ATRAC and MP3 file formats.
cont.entity_b: Rechargeable through USB port. Built-in microphone works well.
Customer service requires a receipt for repairs.
